destinations.name: Anything But Ordinary
destinations.description: Please welcome a NEW arts walk destination to our event featuring the art of Dane Eisenbart.

destinations.name: The Arc Office
destinations.description: Kyle Ashbaugh has attended The Arc's ArtFocus program since 2007. His imaginative work is now being featured in the InSight Gallery.

destinations.name: Art in the Valley
destinations.description:
"Art in the Valley offers a shop full of ""eye candy"" this holiday season. Treats from local artists abound. 

Featured  exhibit, ""Imagine"", showcases new work by oil painter Beatrice Rubenfeld, who delights in the beauty that's out there and translates it into her own vision. Color and nature inspire, the medium is her muse."

destinations.name: The Arts Center
destinations.description:
Interactive Activities at With Wings and Tails:

Why are we drawn to Animals? We marvel at images of animals in nature. The Arts Center presents an opportunity for hands on art & collage making at CAW event. For the rest of the year collages, drawings and paintings made at CAW will be exhibited in an impromptu exhibit With Wings and Tails Annex in the Corrine Woodman Gallery II through Saturday December 31. (pick up January3)

Art supplies provided.

Researchers at Caltech found that our brains “fire” when we see an animal — a dog, a spider, a mouse — but not a person, place or object. The region in the brain is the amygdala, an almond-shaped area associated with emotions. To see if the scientific research is correct, to engage you with animal life of all sorts, to create a moment of that emotion in your brain

Some of the work in With Wings and Tails is sweet and endearing; some addresses animal life in a more realistic way. They can all serve as inspiration for active participation and engagement

Local and regional artists were invited to share their animal friends. They connect and depict animals in a range of media and styles.

destinations.name: ArtWorks (CEI) Gallery
destinations.description:
My work has a variety of overlapping concerns, exploring construction and evolution of self, boundaries of subjectivity, and the interconnection of self and environment through a grounding in material, process and the history of painting.  

In dialog with the long and varied tradition of modernist abstraction, I explore the intersection between painting and sculpture and the extension of painterly language into dimensional applications. 

The role the studio plays in my work is both structural and theoretical—it becomes the subject of the work as well as the frame for the process. Much of my recent work arises out of paying attention to the ecology, evolution and residue of the studio process and reusing and re-purposing material left over from other processes. 

This work is formally driven and playful-- studio objects co-exist with painted surfaces. These forms interbreed and engage each other. Objects influence paintings and paintings become inspiration for objects.

destinations.name: Azure Fine Art Gallery
destinations.description: Art and artists from the Window on Art project.  Ranging from exploratory to practiced and performance to photo this exhibit spans the entirety.  Artists include Christopher Adams, Tanner Henderson, Francisco Morales, Madelaine Corbin, Lauren Ohlgren, Katrina Henry and Lauren Sharpton.

destinations.name: Bison bison!
destinations.description:
The Micro Gallery at Bison bison! will be hosting (recently) local artist Muriel Condon with a collection of small works in graphite and colored pencil. 

Her work creates scenes without context,  focusing on unexpected juxtapositions of everyday objects. With seeming intention, Muriel works between realistic and impressionist representation, placing and choosing objects with a purpose–though imparting meaning is left to the observer. 

Artist reception will be during the Arts Walk from 5-9 pm.

destinations.name: Brittney West Studio
destinations.description: Affordable Eco-Prints starting at just $15 and original art for sale--perfect for holiday gifts! Come see new additions to West's “Animal Activist Artwork” series as well. Pick the artist's brain, enjoy the ambiance and good company—all are welcome!

destinations.name: Corvallis Multicultural Literacy Center
destinations.description: WEARING THE WORLD, 2016 - a multicultural textile exhibit at the Corvallis Multicultural Literacy Center.  Come and get inspired - see a collection of colorful clothing and intricate textiles gathered from around the globe, both vintage and contemporary.  Many hand sewn, hand dyed and embroidered pieces demonstrating a wealth of traditions and techniques, from ceremonial to utilitarian.  The exhibit features pieces from 20 countries, and is enhanced by a continuously running slide show.  Information on the pieces was created for the show by a world-wide, on-line volunteer research program.   The exhibit is curated by CMLC volunteer textile archivist and OSU graduate Ivy She, and was sponsored in part by the Benton County Cultural Coalition.  Exhibit runs through May 31.  Opening 4:00pm – 8:00pm, with a reception and live music from 6:00pm – 8:00pm

destinations.name: Corvallis Swing
destinations.summary: Swing dancing at Old World Deli
destinations.description:
We will be dancing on stage at the Old World Deli as part of the monthly Corvallis Arts Walk!! 

Our time will be short but sweet. Let's dance and celebrate together!!

destinations.name: Corvidopolis
destinations.summary: FALL FUNGUS FIESTA - Visit the CORVIDOPOLIS Studio, view & color some new mushroom prints, draw your favorite fungus and talk fall foraging.

destinations.name: Cyrano's
destinations.description: Cyrano's, taking on favorite games and transforming them into …. books, jewelry, prints,  and sculptures.  Come in and throw the dice or  spin the wheel to see what you might win!

destinations.name: Fairbanks Art Gallery
destinations.description:
Montage Collective is a student-run arts organization of Oregon State University that seeks to both foster camaraderie among artists, as well as promote the arts on and off campus. The annual Montage juried exhibit draws from a pool of OSU students of all majors, traditionally providing a wide spectrum of work in matters of genre, background and intention. 

This year features juror Bruce Burris, who has made a career of establishing programs that provide various supports for artists who are considered to be at risk or considered to be/have disabilities. Burris is the current Director of CEI Artworks in downtown Corvallis, whose storefront exhibition space regularly features work from Oregon artists.

destinations.name: Footwise Storefront Window
destinations.description: For the Window on Art project, Madelaine Corbin's SHOWROOM IV project explores the notion of display and the perceived public and private worlds displays exist in. The two spheres of the public and the private, and the space between the two, is intensely curated, altered, and disguised. Objects are used as items on display to describe, suggest, or project a lifestyle or an identity. Instead of looking at the objects however, SHOWROOM IV examines the hidden and constructed lifestyle by placing that very life on display. What happens when a private life is placed in a public context?

destinations.name: Jeff Hess Studio
destinations.description: Feature exhibit - A selection of eclectic landscape oil paintings & quirky block printed work by local artist Beth Barnett.   Some new work by Jeff Hess on display as well.

destinations.name: Kaleidoscope Studios
destinations.description: Kaleidoscope Studio will have mazes puzzles games hide and seek fun creative exercises and challenges throughout the month and during the Art Walk

destinations.name: Karen Wysopal Studio
destinations.description: After a hiatus from last month's Arts Walk to regroup in my new larger downtown studio, I'm excited to open for December Arts Walk with many new, larger alcohol ink paintings to share with you.  Also colorful holiday cards, small originals, and lots and lots of prints!

destinations.name: Living Room Gallery
destinations.description: Two lovers, united over 1300 miles in the town where they first met.  Paintings by Grace Noel and Nicholas Campbell.

destinations.name: Majestic Theatre
destinations.description: For centuries, plant-life has captured the hearts and minds of artists. Flora has been used as symbols, decorative elements, and subjects of masterpieces. During the month of July, we turn our attention to the green lives that grow all around us. We call upon local artists to help us turn our gallery into a botanical art garden.

destinations.name: OSU Center for the Humanities
destinations.summary: Views of the Columbia Coast. Six photographers share their unique perspectives of the Lower Columbia, from Astoria to Oysterville. Drop-in photo editing demos and advice, 5-7pm.
destinations.description:
Views of the Columbia Coast

A multi-faceted portrait of one of the Northwest's most significant historical regions presented by six local photographers: Rich Bergeman, Allan Doerksen, Dave McIntire, Kurt Norlin, John Ritchie and Dan Wise.

More than 30 color and b+w photographs explore the Lower Columbia Region, from Astoria's historic waterfront and the upriver Brownsmead sloughs, to the mysterious Fort Columbia and the picturesque Washington towns of Ilwaco and Oysterville.

Reception with refreshments from 4-7pm; photo editing demos and advice from 5-7pm. You can also bring your questions to ask the experts as they demonstrate techniques from basic image adjustments to more advanced panorama stitching, composites, and HDR.  Bring your own photographs (on paper, thumb drive, pad or phone) for feedback.

destinations.name: Pegasus Gallery
destinations.description:
Pegasus Gallery hosts an annual rotating exhibit of local and regional artwork - paintings, prints, photography, ceramics, fiber arts and so much more for holiday shoppers enjoyment. Pegasus shares an supports this community, its local makers and the causes that sustain them, and there are several collections for whom a percentage of the proceed are tithed to support organizations that matter to this area. 

This year's exhibit features paintings and mixed media by Bill Shumway, Rachel Urista, Debi Friedlander and Paige Shumway, prints by Kevin Clark, Bonnie Hall and Jim Howland, photography by John Ginn, Don Ferguson, Jeff Hess, Ben McReynolds, Denise Gholsen and Corwin Willard, ceramics by Jan Dymond, Barbara Markello, Becca Lemon, Dale Donovan and Jay Widmer and so much more. Come enjoy the arts and the season and shop local!

destinations.name: PopTart
destinations.description: Poptart & Ugly Art Room present an anti Valentine's Day group art show along with $25 tattoos, a photo booth, snacks & libations by Corvallis Brewing Supply. Check out uglyartroom.com for artist information.

destinations.name: Rachel Urista Studio
destinations.description: Come view the beginning of rather BIG abstract painting - spanning 7.5ft by 5ft, while you browse the Holiday Sale. Original art, fine art prints and coloring books from the artist will be on sale for the gift giving season.

destinations.name: Studio Beatrice
destinations.description: Dale Donovan has an array of new porcelain pottery fresh out of the kiln to show us this month.  Music by Marshall Adams and Wine tasting by Spindrift Cellars.  And plenty of surprises you won't want to miss!

destinations.name: Studio262
destinations.description: Please join Studio262 in our final arts walk as we finish out the year with our Holiday Show and cake! More surprises too, with 40% or more off all art supplies during our one last big community party. Huge thanks to everyone for your support of Studio262 these past few years - We look forward to seeing you during the arts walk!

destinations.name: Teal Cooperative Gallery
destinations.summary: Come watch Harry McManus demonstrate wood turning. Featuring local handcrafted sweets by Melarova Baking and ginger liqueur by Spiritopia.

destinations.name: Voices Gallery
destinations.description: As the year ends, the Artist of Voices creatively depict CLOSURE & RENEWAL.
